intro: Spartium albicans, commonly known as white spartium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Spartium albicans typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various purposes.
